attributes.action: Reconsider Reducing University Fees after the Announcement of a Third Lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: However, uni students have been overlooked once again. We have limited access to resources, with all learning being remote. Though, it may be argued we are receiving high quality teaching online. This is far from reality, online teaching is not of the same quality as face to face teaching. If this is the case why has university teaching not always been online. We demand to be considered for a change. It is neither just or ethical to pay a fee of £9250 for disrupted learning.
attributes.background: The government should reconsider reducing university fees. After a third national lockdown many uni students feel abandoned. We are still expected to produce the same high quality work despite receiving  a fraction of the help. All other sectors of education have been considered.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Implement support for university students during Covid-19
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554299
